text: My team is responsible largely

for security in the
cloud and of the cloud.

So we make sure that all the
Amazon security services are
enabled and running properly.

So as we were scaling up,
we were running CloudTrail

in a single account, putting
the data back into S3 in a

single area, and we were
finding we weren't able

to use the data, so we
needed to find a way
to use the data more effectively.

So we started by trying to
build a solution that was going
to ingest the data into OpenSearch and,
and make it queryable that way.
We were a very small team at the time

of only a couple people, and
so trying to figure out exactly
how to, how to make use of the volume
of data was really important to us.
And CloudTrail Lake came out.
We did some quick testing and, and,

and realized we could enable
it with no actual work.

It was just a couple clicks.
The service was launched
and it was already ingesting the data and,
and allowing us to query it.

CloudTrail data is really
important for us to be able

to investigate security
problems within our environment
to understand what's going on.

It has security data, but
also has operational data.

It's very useful for us
investigating things like right

limiting on APIs, which
can impact our service.
And so we knew we needed to use that data
and we knew it was really valuable to us.

CloudTrail Lake allows us
to pull that data together

and just work with it without
having to become experts,
without having to scale our resources.

In an industry with a lot
of sensitive data, you need
to be able to make sure that you're,
you can see who's touching the data
and who's using what services, and
who's accessing what and when.

And CloudTrail is the
perfect spot for that.
So within hours of turning it on,
we were actually solving problems
and now we're ingesting

that data into our
security operations center,

and they're
reviewing it daily as well,
so we can use it for proactive and,
and reactive security investigations.
AWS enables us to use managed services

to keep our resources low,
to keep our teams lean,

our security organization lean,
so we're able to make sure
that we're protecting our customers data
and our own data on our backend.
